DOCNAME: CASE OF SPASOVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was seriously injured in an explosion caused by a bomb placed in a house located in the municipality of Aracinovo ( “ the municipality ” ) . The incident happened after the DATE armed conflict in the former GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively the applicant , represented by counsel , brought CARDINAL separate actions seeking compensation from the municipality and the ORG . They were subsequently joined .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the first - instance court ” ) accepted the applicant 's claim in respect of the ORG and ordered the latter to pay MONEY ( ORG ) ( CARDINAL ) in respect of non - pecuniary damage , plus interest . It relied on section CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , stating that it had been in force at the time of the incident and that it was still in force . It dismissed the claim in respect of the municipality , stating that it was not liable to be sued ( поради немање на пасивна легитимација ) . It found that section CARDINAL of the amended LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , under which it falls to local self - government units rather than the ORG to pay compensation for any damage caused by acts of violence , had been set aside by ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . The court declared the ORG liable to pay compensation for the damage , because the applicant was the victim of a clear act of violence and no investigation had been carried out by ORG authorities . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . The ORG appealed arguing that ORG decision had not been retroactive and that the ORG accordingly , could not be held liable to be sued . The appeal was received by the first - instance court on DATE and communicated to the applicant on DATE . The applicant did not submit any observations in reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeal and overturned the lower court 's decision in part related to the ORG . It confirmed the remainder , because no appeal had been lodged in that respect . The court endorsed the facts established by the first - instance court but held that the substantive law had been incorrectly applied . It found that section CARDINAL of the amended LAW had already entered into force at the time of the incident and applied in the applicant 's case given the non - retroactive legal effect of ORG decision . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked the public prosecutor to institute legality review proceedings ( барање за заштита на законитоста ) before ORG . He argued that both courts had accepted that he had sustained a bodily injury as a result of acts of violence or terrorism . However , no compensation had been awarded owing to the contradictory decisions of the first and second - instance courts as to who had been the proper defendant to his action .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor informed the applicant that there were no grounds for lodging such a request against ORG decision .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE provided for the ORG 's responsibility for any damage caused , inter alia , by a bodily injury sustained as a result of acts of violence or terrorism .
CARDINAL . On DATE LAW was amended . Under section CARDINAL of the amended LAW , the term “ the ORG ” was replaced with “ the local self - government units where damage occurred ” .
CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of LAW ( “ the LAW ” ) , as valid at the time , parties can appeal the first - instance decision within DATE of the date of service of this latter decision .

CARDINAL . LAW ( CARDINAL ) prescribes the following as a substantial procedural flaw : if the impugned decision contains deficiencies which makes its review impossible , in particular if it is illegible , contradictory , lacks reasoning or does not provide reasons for the relevant findings of fact or if they are unclear or contradictory .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of the Act , the second - instance court examines the first - instance court 's decision in the challenged part . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that ORG examines the first - instance court 's decision on the basis of the grounds set out in the appeal and having regard to its ex officio capacity to consider any substantial procedural flaw and the correct application of the law .

CARDINAL . ORG rejected ( укинува ) section CARDINAL of the amended LAW as unconstitutional . It found that it was the ORG 's responsibility to protect citizens from acts of violence and , accordingly , to cover any damage thereof .
